summary: This is an email chain from November 24, 2008, between Assistant U.S. Attorney Ann Marie C. Villafana and defense attorney Roy Black regarding Jeffrey Epstein. The email includes a forwarded message asking if anything has been heard back, and Villafana requests Black review an attached letter.

persons.name: Ann Marie C. Villafana
persons.context: She sends an email to Roy Black requesting he review an attached letter regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: He is the recipient of an email from AUSA Villafana regarding Jeffrey Epstein and is asked to review an attached letter.

persons.name: Karen Atkinson
persons.context: She is copied on the email from Villafana to Roy Black regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: He is the subject of the email correspondence and the attached letter being discussed between federal prosecutors and a defense attorney.

connections.description: Villafana, a prosecutor, is sending correspondence to Black, a defense attorney, regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case.
Both are Assistant U.S. Attorneys; Atkinson is copied on Villafana's email to Roy Black.
The email context implies Roy Black is acting as defense attorney for Jeffrey Epstein, as he is being sent case-related correspondence by prosecutors.

events.title: Prosecutor Correspondence with Defense
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Ann Marie C. Villafana emails defense attorney Roy Black regarding Jeffrey Epstein, asking him to review an attached letter.

locations.context: The listed address for the Assistant U.S. Attorney's office.

keyFacts: The document is an email from November 24, 2008, showing communication between federal prosecutors and defense attorney Roy Black regarding Jeffrey Epstein.
It indicates Roy Black was involved as defense counsel for Jeffrey Epstein during the federal investigation in late 2008.
The email references an attached letter (file: 081124 tr to Black.pdf) which is likely a formal legal communication regarding the Epstein case.
